Does not install or configure the actual npm package
Requires Angular 17+ standalone components for best results

best_practices: Initialize ACL early using APP_INITIALIZER after authentication completes
Use computed signals with ACL for reactive permission checks

faq.question: What Angular versions are supported?
faq.answer: @delon/acl supports Angular 17+ with standalone components and Angular 20+ with @if control flow.

faq.question: What permission formats does @delon/acl support?
faq.answer: It supports role-based (admin, user) and ability-based (task:create, blueprint:edit) permissions with oneOf/allOf modes.

faq.question: How does @delon/acl integrate with authentication?
faq.answer: Use @delon/auth for authentication then initialize ACLService with user roles in APP_INITIALIZER.

faq.question: Is client-side ACL secure enough?
faq.answer: No. Client-side ACL only hides UI elements. Always implement server-side validation for data access.

faq.question: Can I use ACL with Angular signals?
faq.answer: Yes. Create computed signals like: canEdit = computed(() => aclService.can('task:edit')).

faq.question: How is this different from other Angular permission libraries?
faq.answer: @delon/acl is part of the ng-alain ecosystem with built-in directives, guards, and deep Angular integration.
